rComments: I did most of practice questions in the textbook, looked into old exams, went to study groups, I asked friends who were better at stats for help. I studied hard and still bombed the final. His lecture notes are impossible to understand. He is a difficult professor to talk to. He has no sense of compassion for those of us not mathematically inclined

A good professor, clearly knows his stuff, perhaps too much. He has the tendency to overcomplicate a lot of concepts during lectures so you will have to spend a lot of time deciphering your lecture notes. His quizzes and tests are fair, as long as you understand most of the lectures, you should be fine.
teacherRatingTags: ['Lecture heavy', 'Clear grading criteria', "Skip class? You won't pass."]

rComments: Mohsen makes things harder than they are by adding seemingly random and hard-to-follow steps. We got a cheatsheet on the final, but it was still hard because I learned absolutely nothing over the semester. He writes the whole textbook down on the board and leaves it up to you to figure out whats going on. Avoid at all costs.
teacherRatingTags: ['Lecture heavy', 'Get ready to read', "Skip class? You won't pass."]

rComments: shouldn't be a teacher if you hate your students so much. threatened to "call campus police and put a mark on our permanent record" if we attended other lecture sessions without permission. heavy accent and ridiculously small unreadable writing. says "you should know this" when ppl ask questions in an introductory course
Heavy accent, extremely small and bad handwriting, read from script for the whole lecture and provided useless information during tutorials.

Couldn't understand him at all bc of his thick accent, so lectures didn't help. But his lecture notes were very detailed. Read the textbook, read the lecture notes and do tb questions and you'll be fine. Not very hard if your good at math. Exams are quite easy if you studied all the material.

Knows his stuff but language barriers can be a hindrance to his teaching, nevertheless his material is fairly easy, doesn't give homework. Gives bonus questions worth 9-12 % marks based on a first (correct) answers basis. Lecture notes are concise and easy to understand but he sometimes makes mistakes that can derail you for a few minutes.
The prof is knowledgeable, however the exams are very difficult and do not reflect what is taught in lectures. Thankfully the tutorial quizzes are simple and will therefore increase your final grade.
teacherRatingTags: ['Tough grader', 'Get ready to read', 'Lots of homework']

rComments: I am shocked at how bad he is at teaching. I took this during the summer semester and it was extremely difficult. I don't know about other profs, but I would avoid him at all costs since one literally can't understand what he says during the lectures, no point attending them. He reads off a PDF riddled w/ spelling mistakes and there is no weboption

This professor is very knowledgeable in terms of stats. He is very technical and his lecture slides tend to be too much or confusing. He talks fast, & gives 10% extra credit during the semester. I was never able to get it because he focuses it on the R software and you need to know how to use it well to get the credit! make sure to go to reviews!

This professor speaks too quietly and uses the blackboard frequently to write notes. Unfortunately, his handwriting is very small and hard to read if you aren't sitting in the front row. I did not like the way he taught the course content, as I felt that he used too many technical terms/complex notations without properly explaining what they meant.
he is great!

This prof knows his statistics. Lecture notes are very detailed but sometimes hard to understand without the use of the textbook. He encourages and wants his students to do well, and even gives out extra credit (10%) so be sure to attend lectures. Overall, a solid teacher if you work hard. Makes you work for the grade you get in the end.

STAB22 is definitely a hard course but Soltanifar genuinely cares about his students. He offers many exam review sessions that are very helpful in understanding the material. If you go to lectures and study what he tells you to focus on, there are no surprises on the exams. His accent is easy to understand if you follow along with the notes.

Needs to slow down when teaching. As well, he overcomplicates the concepts of what was taught in lecture. Overall, well-respected and really cares about his students and wants everyone to pass the course.
His notes are very detailed, more detailed than needed for the evaluations. Thats great because your very prepared for the evaluations.

I think this was his first time teaching. Sit in front of the class because it's not very easy to hear/understand him. Lecture slides are clear, quizzes straight forward. He gives chances for bonus marks in lecture-make sure to attend. Review sessions amazing, he tells you what to focus on. Make good help sheets for exam esp with difficult examples
teacherRatingTags: ['Participation matters', "Skip class? You won't pass.", 'EXTRA CREDIT']

rComments: His lecture notes did not make sense, I showed up to every class, I did at least half the assignment questions per chapter and though I could grasp the basic questions asked in the textbook, I still could not understand his lectures.

Definitely is a smart professor who knows a lot about Statistics. However, not at all a good teacher. Never explains the concepts properly, just reads them of the slide. We need to understand why we're using what we are using, where did it come from, how it is usefull, etc,... Thus, lectures are 90% useless. Everything i learn is from books, notes

Stats isn't a course where you can skip, not do the work and expect an A. If you do the assigned chapters, attend class, and ask questions, you can do well even with no previous math experience. Soltanifar is a great prof! He tells you what to expect on exams and helps you do well. Always available to help!
teacherRatingTags: ['Clear grading criteria', 'Gives good feedback', 'Lots of homework']

rComments: Prof Soltanifar is very knowledgeable. He knows all of his stuff and knows how to express them to the class. Although he has an accent, you can still understand him clearly. He is very helpful outside of class as well. His mid-term was straightforward if you studied all of his lecture slides clearly as well as doing the corresponding homework.
Accent makes it hard to understand what hes saying
teacherRatingTags: ['Get ready to read', 'Lots of homework', 'Lecture heavy']

rComments: Mohsen was not at all good at explaining concepts clearly. He often actually made things seem a lot harder than they actually were. You're better off studying from the textbook.

He has accent, but is understandable as long as you sit in the front rows. Although he doesn't explain concepts well during his lectures, he makes excellent lecture notes! One of the most detailed lecture notes I've ever had. If you are a hardworking student, it is easy to get an A. If not, don't expect to learn anything by only attending lectures

There's no doubt a lot of work in STAB22 but if you do the readings and attend lecture, you'll get a good grade. Prof Soltanifar cares about his students, is very knowledgeable and adds certain content to allow us to be at the top of our field. His accent isn't very strong and anything that isn't easy to understand, he writes on the board for us.

Intentionally makes lecture notes harder and more confusing than the textbook to show off his mathematical background (showed off his GPA in the first class) and makes us feel bad if we weren't taking notes. Accent way too thick to understand, teaches things that are too high level/ not intended for STAB22 (confirmed this with a couple of stats TAs

His accent is extremely difficult to understand, reads off of his notes so the lectures are basically useless, very rude you ask him a question. Spends half of the class lecturing us about how we're all going to work at Starbucks after we graduate if we don't do his bonus questions...

Had Mohsen as a TA last year, he really cares about students and goes the extra mile to make sure you understand and succeed in this course. Without him I wouldn't have the experience + knowledge that I have in the field of statistics now. Tells you exactly what to focus on so there aren't any surprises on quizzes/exams. Phenomenal teacher!
